sen.j: 山陽道（さんようどう、せんようどう、かげとものみち）、影面道、光面道（かげとものみち）
sen.e: Sanyodo (Senyodo or Kagetomo-no-michi)
sen.cmt: 漢字表記を示しているので、読み方だけを記載しました。
sen.e: Sanyodo (Senyodo or Kagetomo-no-michi) can mean:
sen.cmt: Thought needs to be given to the way the information is laid out on the actual page. A look at the actual page from Japanese Wikipedia suggests to me that this will be introducing the two possible meanings this term has.
sen.e: Sanyodo (Senyodo or Kagetomo-no-michi) can mean:

sen.j: 五畿七道の一つで、本州の瀬戸内海側。
sen.e: One of the Goki-Shichido, a region of Honshu along the Seto Inland Sea
A region of Honshu along the Seto Inland Sea that was one of the Goki-Shichido (literally, "five provinces and seven circuits") administrative divisions.
A region of Honshu along the Seto Inland Sea that was one of the Goki-Shichido (literally, "five provinces and seven circuits") administrative divisions.

sen.j: 五畿七道の山陽道を通る幹線道路。
sen.e: A highway traversing Sanyodo of Goki-Shichido
A highway that traversed the Sanyodo, in Goki-Shichido.
A highway that traversed Sanyodo, which was one of the Goki-Shichido.
sen.cmt: コンマと前置詞を修正。

sen.j: 律令時代に整備された物。
sen.e: A route developed in the Ritsuryo era
A route built during the Ritsuryo period.
A route built during the Ritsuryo period.

sen.j: 江戸時代に整備された物（西国街道）。
sen.e: A route developed in the Edo era (Saigoku-kaido)
A route built in the Edo period (Saigoku-kaido).
A route built in the Edo period (Saigoku-kaido).

sen.j: 山陽自動車道の略称。
sen.e: A contracted word of the Sanyo Jidoshado Expressway
An abbreviation for "Sanyo Jidoshado Expressway."
An abbreviation for "Sanyo Jidoshado Expressway."

sen.j: 行政区画としての山陽道
sen.e: Sanyodo as an administrative division
Administrative division
sen.cmt: I realize this deviates from the Japanese a little but as this is a heading, I think simply "Administrative division" would be sufficient.
sen.e: Administrative division

sen.j: 令制国一覧 > 山陽道
sen.e: List of Ryoseikoku > Sanyodo
See also: List of ryoseikoku
sen.cmt: This would usually appear as "See also: Ryoseikoku" on an English page on Wikipedia. (e.g. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michigan)
sen.e: See also: List of ryoseikoku

sen.j: 五畿七道の一つで、本州の瀬戸内海側を指す。
sen.e: One of the Goki-Shichido, referring to a region of Honshu along the Seto Inland Sea
One of the Goki-Shichido, referring to a region of Honshu along the Seto Inland Sea
One of the Goki-Shichido, referring to a region of Honshu along the Seto Inland Sea

sen.j: 畿内の西に位置し、現在の兵庫県西部から山口県までに至る瀬戸内海沿岸を総称した。
sen.e: Regions west of Kinai and along the Seto Inland Sea, present-day West Hyogo Prefecture to Yamaguchi Prefecture, was collectively called Sanyodo.
The region west of Kinai and along the Seto Inland Sea, from present-day West Hyogo Prefecture to Yamaguchi Prefecture, was collectively called Sanyodo.
The region west of Kinai and along the Seto Inland Sea, from present-day West Hyogo Prefecture to Yamaguchi Prefecture, was collectively called Sanyodo.

sen.j: 播磨国
sen.e: Harima-no-kuni
Harima-no-kuni
Harima-no-kuni

sen.j: 美作国 - 713年（和銅6年）に備前国より分割。
sen.e: Mimasaka-no-kuni - separated from Bizen-no-kuni in 713
Mimasaka-no-kuni - separated from Bizen-no-kuni in 713.
Mimasaka-no-kuni - separated from Bizen-no-kuni in 713.

sen.j: 備前国
sen.e: Bizen-no-kuni
Bizen-no-kuni
Bizen-no-kuni

sen.j: 備中国
sen.e: Bichu-no-kuni
Bichu-no-kuni
Bichu-no-kuni

sen.j: 備後国
sen.e: Bingo-no-kuni
Bingo-no-kuni
Bingo-no-kuni

sen.j: 安芸国
sen.e: Aki-no-kuni
Aki-no-kuni
Aki-no-kuni

sen.j: 周防国
sen.e: Suo-no-kuni
Suo-no-kuni
Suo-no-kuni

sen.j: 長門国
sen.e: Nagato-no-kuni
Nagato-no-kuni
Nagato-no-kuni

tit.cmt: I realize this deviates from the Japanese a little but as this is a heading, I think simply "Highway" would be sufficient.

sen.j: 律令制時代の道路としての山陽道は、畿内（難波京、平城京、平安京）と北部九州（大宰府、博多）を結んでいた。
sen.e: In the Ritsuryo era, the Sanyodo connected Kinai (Naniwa-kyo, Heijo-kyo, and Heian-kyo) and North Kyushu (Dazaifu and Hakata).
During the Ritsuryo period the Sanyodo connected Kinai (Naniwa-kyo, Heijo-kyo, and Heian-kyo) and North Kyushu (Dazaifu and Hakata).
During the Ritsuryo period the Sanyodo connected Kinai (Naniwa-kyo, Heijo-kyo, and Heian-kyo) and North Kyushu (Dazaifu and Hakata).

sen.j: 外国の使節が通行し、宿泊する事が想定されたため、七道の中で唯一の大路に格付けされ、最重視された。
sen.e: The Sanyodo was only the first grade highway among the Shichido and regarded as the most important because of expected passage and stays of foreign missions.
The Sanyodo was only the first graded highway among the Shichido, and as such it was regarded as the most important because of the expected passage and stays of foreign missions.
The Sanyodo was only the first graded highway among the Shichido, and as such it was regarded as the most important because of the expected passage and stays of foreign missions.

sen.j: 平城京、平安京などの都の変遷に応じて、道路の東端は変化した。
sen.e: Its eastern end of the road varied in response to the transfer of capitals such as Heijo-kyo and Heian-kyo.
The eastern end of the road varied in response to the transfer of capitals such as Heijo-kyo and Heian-kyo.
The eastern end of the road varied in response to the transfer of capitals such as Heijo-kyo and Heian-kyo.

sen.j: 古代の山陽道は道幅約6mから9m、道筋は直線的で、各国の国府を効率良く結んでいた。
sen.e: The ancient Sanyodo was approximately 6 to 9 meters wide and mostly straight in such a way as Kokufu in regions are connected efficiently.
The ancient Sanyodo was approximately six to nine meters wide and generally straight in such a way that Kokufu and other areas throughout the region could be connected efficiently.
sen.cmt: Added: and other areas throughout the
sen.e: The ancient Sanyodo was approximately six to nine meters wide and generally straight in such a way that Kokufu and other areas throughout the region could be connected efficiently.

sen.j: 本道から外れた美作国へは、播磨国から西北に道路が伸びていた。
sen.e: The Sanyodo stretched northwest from Harima-no-kuni to go to Mimasaka-no-kuni, which was away from the main route.
The Sanyodo stretched northwest from Harima-no-kuni to Mimasaka-no-kuni, which was away from the main route.
The Sanyodo stretched northwest from Harima-no-kuni to Mimasaka-no-kuni, which was away from the main route.

sen.j: 江戸幕府は、五街道を筆頭にする街道整備政策の延長線上に、山陽道の整備を置いた。
sen.e: The Edo Shogunate improved the Sanyodo as part of its road maintenance policy focusing on 5 major highways.
sen.cmt: 五街道を重点においた街道整備政策の一部として山陽道を整備したと訳しました。
sen.e: The Edo shogunate improved the Sanyodo as part of its road maintenance policy, which focused on five major highways.
The Edo shogunate improved the Sanyodo as part of its road maintenance policy, which focused on five major highways.

sen.j: 宿駅は42箇所設置された。
sen.e: There were 42 Yadoeki along the highway.
There were 42 yadoeki along the highway.
There were 42 yadoeki along the highway.

sen.j: 江戸時代の山陽道は西国街道とも呼ばれており、京都と下関市を結んでおり、下関から関門海峡を越えて小倉市へと至った。
sen.e: In the Edo era, the Sanyodo alias Saigoku-kaido connected Kyoto to Shimonoseki City and further extended to Kokura City by crossing Kammon-kaikyo Strait from Shimonoseki.
During the Edo period, the Sanyodo (otherwise known as Saigoku-kaido) connected Kyoto to Shimonoseki City and further extended to Kokura City by crossing the Kammon-kaikyo Strait from Shimonoseki.
During the Edo period, the Sanyodo (otherwise known as Saigoku-kaido) connected Kyoto to Shimonoseki City and further extended to Kokura City by crossing the Kammon-kaikyo Strait from Shimonoseki.

sen.j: これは、江戸と長崎市を結ぶ幹線道路の一角でもあった。
sen.e: This route was a part of the truck line linking Edo and Nagasaki City.
This route was part of the truck line linking Edo and Nagasaki City.
This route was part of the truck line linking Edo and Nagasaki City.

sen.j: 明治政府は、国道に番号を付けて管理する制度を採った。
sen.e: The Meiji Government started its road management system by assigning numbers to national highways
The Meiji government started its road management system by assigning numbers to national highways.
The Meiji government started its road management system by assigning numbers to national highways.

sen.j: 江戸時代までの山陽道は、明治時代には東京市と神戸市を結ぶ国道3号（2号から京都市で分岐）、および、東京と長崎市を結ぶ国道4号の一部になり、大正時代には東京と鹿児島市を結ぶ国道2号（1号から三重県で分岐）の一部になった。
sen.e: In the Meiji ear, the Sanyodo of the Edo era and earlier became a section of National Highway 3 connecting Tokyo City and Kobe City (separating from National Highway 2 in Kyoto City); and of National Highway 4 connecting Tokyo and Ngasaki City; in the Taisho era, it was integrated into National Highway 2 (separating from National Highway 1 in Mie Prefecture).

During the Meiji period, the Sanyodo of the Edo period and earlier became a section of National Highway 3 connecting Tokyo City and Kobe City (separating from National Highway 2 in Kyoto City); and of National Highway 4 connecting Tokyo and Ngasaki City; during the Taisho period, it was integrated into National Highway 2 (separating from National Highway 1 in Mie Prefecture).

During the Meiji period, the Sanyodo of the Edo period and earlier became a section of National Highway 3 connecting Tokyo City and Kobe City (separating from National Highway 2 in Kyoto City); and of National Highway 4 connecting Tokyo and Nagasaki City; during the Taisho period it was integrated into National Highway 2 connecting Tokyo and Kagoshima City (separating from National Highway 1 in Mie Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 訳を補いました。スペルミス

sen.j: 現在では、山陽道は、大阪市と北九州市を結ぶ国道2号に引き継がれている。
sen.e: The Sanyodo has been passed down to National Highway 2 today, which connects Osaka City and Kita Kyushu City.
The Sanyodo has been passed down to National Highway 2 today, which connects Osaka City and Kita Kyushu City.
The Sanyodo has been passed down to National Highway 2 today, which connects Osaka City and Kita Kyushu City.

sen.j: しかし、律令時代や江戸時代の山陽道とは異なる道筋の部分も多い。
sen.e: Its route, however, differs from that in the Ritsuryo era and Edo era in many areas.
Its route, however, differs from that of the Ritsuryo and Edo periods in many places.
Its route, however, differs from that of the Ritsuryo and Edo periods in many places.

sen.j: 岡山県岡山市～広島県福山市にかけての国道2号は大幅に異なるルート（鴨方往来）を通る。
sen.e: National Highway 2 from Okayama City (Okayama Prefecture) to Fukuyama City (Hiroshima Prefecture) takes greatly different route (Kamoga Orai Route)..
National Highway 2 from Okayama City (Okayama Prefecture) to Fukuyama City (Hiroshima Prefecture) takes a very different route (Kamoga Orai Route).
National Highway 2 from Okayama City (Okayama Prefecture) to Fukuyama City (Hiroshima Prefecture) takes a very different route (Kamogata-orai Route).
sen.cmt: 「鴨方往来」の訳を変更しました。

sen.j: また、鉄道の山陽本線や山陽新幹線、高速道路の山陽自動車道も、ほぼ古来の山陽道に沿って敷設されている。
sen.e: When it comes to the railways of the Sanyo Main Line and the Sanyo Shnikansen Line, the Sanyo Jidoshado Expressway follows roughly along the historical Sanyodo.
sen.cmt: または訳出していません。
sen.e: When it comes to the railways of the Sanyo Main Line and the Sanyo Shnikansen Line, the Sanyo Jidoshado Expressway roughly follows the historical Sanyodo.
The Sanyo Jidoshado Expressway and the railway lines of the Sanyo Main Line and the Sanyo Shinkansen Line roughly follow the historical Sanyodo.
sen.cmt: This was a mistranslation, I think. I have had to adjust the order in which information is presented for clarity.

sen.j: 現代においても、近畿地方と九州を結ぶ機能を律令時代から維持し続けている。
sen.e: The Sanyodo has served its function of connecting Kinki region and Kyushu since the Ritsuryo era and it still continues the function today.
The Sanyodo has served its function of connecting the Kinki region and Kyushu since the Ritsuryo period, and it continues in that function today.
The Sanyodo has served its function of connecting the Kinki region and Kyushu since the Ritsuryo period, and it continues in that manner today.

sen.j: 現在において「山陽道」と呼んだ場合には、「山陽自動車道」のことを指す。
sen.e: When people say "Sanyodo" today, they refer to Sanyo Jidoshado Highway.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外訳出
sen.e: When people say "Sanyodo" today, they are generally referring to the Sanyo Jidoshado Highway.
When people say "Sanyodo" today, they are generally referring to the Sanyo Jidoshado Highway.

sen.j: 岡山県岡山市～広島県福山市にかけて、国道2号がかつての山陽道を踏襲していないこともあって、かつての山陽道やそれに並行する道路は「旧山陽道」と呼ぶのが岡山県や広島県東部では、一般的となっている。
sen.e: The historical Sanyodo or roads running in parallel with it are generally called "Old Sanyodo" in Okayama Prefecture and East Hiroshima Prefecture, because National Highway 2 does not follow it between Okayama City (Okayama Prefecture) and Fukuyama City(Hiroshima Prefecture).,.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外訳出
sen.e: The historical Sanyodo and the roads running in parallel with it are collectively called "Old Sanyodo" in Okayama Prefecture and East Hiroshima Prefecture, because National Highway 2 does not follow it between Okayama City (Okayama Prefecture) and Fukuyama City(Hiroshima Prefecture).

The historical Sanyodo and the roads running in parallel with it are collectively called "Old Sanyodo" in Okayama Prefecture and East Hiroshima Prefecture, because National Highway 2 does not follow it between Okayama City (Okayama Prefecture) and Fukuyama City (Hiroshima Prefecture).
